alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 12:52AM CDT until May 11 at 8:44AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River Near Benkelman 1sw affecting Hitchcock and Dundy Counties. For the Republican River...including Benkelman 1sw...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Republican River Near Benkelman 1sw. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Lowland areas from near the gage to the confluence of the South Fork of the Republican River will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM MDT Wednesday /12:30 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 3.3 feet. - Forecast...The river stage was 3.2 feet at 11:30 PM CDT. The river is forecast to rise to 6.1 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 745 AM MDT /845 AM CDT/.
